news.title: Registration of properties in Mumbai region up 20% in November at 12,219 units
news.para: Mumbai's property market experienced a remarkable surge in November. The volume of registered real estate soared by 20% compared to last year, marking the highest level for November since 2013. Additionally, stamp duty revenues enjoyed a substantial boost.

news.title: Odisha government asks collectors to allocate sites to landless beneficiaries of housing schemes
news.para: Odisha government is urging district collectors to prioritize house site allocation for landless families. Many beneficiaries of Pradhan Mantri Awaas Yojana-Gramin and Pradhan Mantri Janjati Adivasi Nyaya Maha Abhiyan still await land. Over two lakh landless households were identified in a recent survey. The administration is working to resolve these pending allocations.

news.title: Mumbai housing societies turn the tables on builders, drive hard bargain during redevelopment
news.para: Housing societies in Mumbai are leveraging a strong developer market to demand significantly higher compensation and additional area for redevelopment projects. These inflated expectations, often 15-25% above market rates, are driven by a 'herd mentality' and a perception of a booming market, leading some credible developers to withdraw from negotiations.

news.title: Hyderabad: Amid big ticket land auctions, 40% of Neopolis homes struggling for buyers
news.para: Despite high-stakes land auctions, Neopolis faces a significant real estate challenge with 40% of launched homes unsold, particularly larger units. Developers are resorting to steep price cuts and innovative payment plans to attract buyers, while some larger projects face doubts about completion.

news.title: Builders in Chennai want government to stop enforcement of grid of roads plan
news.para: Realtors are urging the state government to halt the Chennai Metropolitan Development Authority's (CMDA) enforcement of its grid of roads plan. Developers claim the plan, which cuts through existing buildings, is being implemented without a proper government order, causing significant project delays and hardship. They request a suspension until a detailed study and official notification are issued.

news.title: From Jan 1, apply for nods for small housing projects online in Goa
news.para: The Town and Country Planning Department in Panaji will require online building plan approvals for constructions up to four apartments starting January 1. This move aims to streamline processes and cut red tape. However, larger residential and commercial projects will continue to be processed manually. Completion orders will necessitate prior online plan approvals.

news.title: Hyderabad: Seven years on, no funds yet for 27 merging urban bodies
news.para: Seven years after their formation, 27 municipalities approved for merger with GHMC are struggling with basic amenities and financial support, relying heavily on meager property tax collections. Despite the merger approval, these urban local bodies may continue functioning separately as GHMC faces its own financial crunch, delaying a wider reorganization.

news.title: Full waiver on interest for property tax defaulters in Patna
news.para: Patna Municipal Corporation offers a significant relief, waiving all interest and penalties on property tax dues until March 31, 2026. Property owners can now settle outstanding taxes by paying only the principal amount in a single installment. This one-time settlement scheme applies to all property types and even those with pending legal cases, provided they withdraw them.

news.title: Guntur civic body to cut water supply to tax evaders’ properties
news.para: Guntur Municipal Corporation is taking strict action against property tax defaulters. Civic amenities like water taps and drainage connections will be disconnected for those with pending dues. Officials are held accountable for revenue generation. Ward secretaries failing to meet daily targets face show-cause notices and potential suspension.

news.title: Andhra Pradesh cabinet approves pooling 16,666 acres for Amaravati under second phase
news.para: The Andhra Pradesh Cabinet has approved the second phase of land pooling for Amaravati, involving 16,666 acres from seven villages. This move aims to develop key infrastructure for the new capital. The Cabinet also sanctioned a Rs 5,000 crore loan for paddy procurement and new rules for urban local body advertisements.

news.title: Central government plans to develop Belgaria in Jharkhand as model township: Coal secretary
news.para: Dhanbad's Belgaria is undergoing a remarkable transformation into a model township. The government's new initiative will ensure all essential amenities such as clean water, reliable electricity, and job opportunities for its residents. Displaced families will be offered homes in this modern community, aimed at providing a sanctuary away from the dangers of fire and subsidence.

news.title: China plans to expand REITs market as Vanke woes spark concerns over developers
news.para: China is broadening its real estate investment trust market to embrace commercial properties. This initiative surfaces amid significant financial hurdles faced by developer Vanke. The securities regulator has unveiled preliminary guidelines for a pilot program designed to bolster growth within the real estate sector.

news.title: Hyderabad: Four acres land parcel in Neopolis auctioned for ₹609 crore
news.para: Hyderabad's Neopolis land auction shattered previous records, fetching an astonishing Rs 151.25 crore per acre for a 4.03-acre plot. This surge, with another parcel selling at Rs 147.75 crore per acre, has pushed the HMDA's revenue to Rs 1,352 crore in a single day.  The success solidifies Neopolis as a prime real estate hub.

news.title: Five plots auctioned, Ahmedabad civic body expects to earn ₹473.7 crore
news.para: Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation successfully auctioned five plots across Shilaj, Chandkheda, Sola, and Vastral. The sales generated a significant Rs 473.7 crore for the corporation. Several plots fetched prices well above their base rates, indicating strong market interest. This revenue will contribute to the AMC's financial resources.

news.title: Eight years late, Ghaziabad development body now starts to hand over PMAY houses
news.para: After an eight-year delay, Ghaziabad Development Authority (GDA) has commenced handing over flats to Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana-urban (PMAY) beneficiaries in Madhuban Bapudham, with over 300 registries completed. Work is also finished in other zones, with possessions expected soon, despite initial funding and infrastructure challenges.

news.title: No construction without plinth marking in Bengaluru, say civic authorities
news.para: Bengaluru Central City Corporation has mandated plinth-line marking, plan verification, and time-bound demolition for all constructions to curb violations. Senior officials are now responsible for ensuring compliance, with approved plans accessible to field staff for verification. A clear protocol for handling complaints and issuing demolition orders has been established, empowering officials to stop illegal works and recover costs from owners.

news.title: Nagpur: Kesar India buys 24,256 sq meter land parcel in Hingna for township
news.para: Kesar India Limited has acquired a significant land parcel in Hingna, Nagpur, for a substantial mixed-use development. The project, featuring premium residential and commercial spaces, is projected to generate approximately 900 crore in revenue, reflecting Nagpur's growing real estate market and increasing demand for housing and commercial facilities.

news.title: Sebi reclassifies REIT as equity to boost market participation
news.para: Starting January 1, 2026, Sebi will categorize Real Estate Investment Trusts as equity-related instruments, a move designed to attract greater investment from mutual and specialized funds. In this shift, Infrastructure Investment Trusts will retain their status as hybrid instruments, while current investments will be protected under grandfathering provisions.

news.title: Shree Cement's premiumisation drive not tied to targets, 80 MT capacity by FY29 on track: Chairman
news.para: Shree Cement is embracing a strategy that prioritizes premium offerings over sheer volume. Aiming to boost its production capacity to 80 million tonnes by FY'29, this approach reflects an evolving consumer demand for enhanced quality. Alongside this, the company is diversifying its ready-mix concrete business and reinforcing its operations in the UAE.

news.title: Mindspace REIT acquires assets in Mumbai & Pune from K Raheja Corp for ₹29.2 billion
news.para: Mindspace REIT is acquiring three central business district assets for ₹29.2 billion from K Raheja Corp. The acquisition is set to enhance net operating income and distribution per unit. The deal involves properties in Mumbai and Pune, strengthening the REIT's market presence.
